intro: Schrankia chapmanii, commonly known as the Chapman's schrankia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Schrankia within the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and related plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers in early spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Schrankia chapmanii is notable for its drought tolerance and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
